categories.name: PET (Polyethylene Terephthalate)
categories.recycling_process: Plastic is shredded, melted down, and turned into new plastic products such as bottles, clothing, and insulation.
categories.environmental_impact: High energy usage during recycling but can be reused multiple times.

categories.name: HDPE (High-Density Polyethylene)
categories.recycling_process: HDPE is cleaned, shredded, and melted to create new products like piping, plastic lumber, and recycling bins.
categories.environmental_impact: Low environmental impact in the recycling process.

categories.name: PVC (Polyvinyl Chloride)
categories.recycling_process: PVC is difficult to recycle due to the toxic chemicals released during the process, but can be used in some specialized applications.

categories.name: Clear Glass
categories.recycling_process: Glass is melted down and remolded into new containers or other products like tiles and insulation.
categories.recyclability: Infinitely recyclable without loss of quality

categories.name: Colored Glass
categories.recycling_process: Similar to clear glass, but may require separation and additional steps to remove colorants.
categories.environmental_impact: Low impact; requires sorting to remove contaminants.

categories.name: Aluminum
categories.recycling_process: Aluminum is melted and recast into new products such as cans, foil, and automotive parts.
categories.recyclability: Highly recyclable, retains quality after multiple cycles
categories.environmental_impact: Low energy usage compared to primary aluminum production.

categories.name: Steel
categories.recycling_process: Steel is shredded, melted down, and recast into new products like beams, cans, and appliances.
categories.environmental_impact: Low impact; often requires high-temperature melting.

categories.name: Cardboard
categories.recycling_process: Cardboard is flattened, pulped, and reformed into new cardboard products.
categories.recyclability: Highly recyclable, but can be contaminated with food waste
categories.environmental_impact: Low energy impact, but can be affected by contamination.

categories.name: Office Paper
categories.recycling_process: Paper is shredded, pulped, and filtered to remove inks and adhesives, then used to make new paper products.

categories.name: Food Scraps
categories.recycling_process: Food scraps are composted to create nutrient-rich soil for gardening and agriculture.
categories.environmental_impact: Highly beneficial to soil, reduces methane emissions in landfills.

categories.name: Yard Waste
categories.recycling_process: Yard waste is composted or used to generate biogas energy.
categories.recyclability: Easily recyclable through composting or energy production
categories.environmental_impact: Reduces landfill waste and supports sustainable energy production.
